oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery interviews Dolly Parton - Live - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Dolly Parton (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Dolly Parton. Recording is performed in front of a live audience. Recording is from September 29, 1994. Tape is labeled part 3.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Dolly Parton
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Dolly Parton discusses the changes she made in life when she found God -- (01:01) Ralph Emery invites Parton to reflect on her time where she experienced loss of faith and depression -- (02:27) Emery and Parton discuss the amount of knowledge Parton has on the Bible -- (03:54) Emery invites Parton to promote her album: Heartsongs - Live From Dollywood -- (05:35) Parton talks about the home she bought that is featured on the album -- (06:35) Emery inquires about the statue that was dedicated to Parton, and praises Parton for her community assistance -- (09:37) Emery addresses the question and answer section that Parton had in her book; additionally, Parton reflects on why she does not have children -- (11:02) Emery inquires about Parton's definition of love, and Parton recalls visiting her father's hometown -- (12:22) Emery questions Parton about how she wishes to be remembered -- (12:58) Parton and Emery joke about recommending Parton's book, and Emery says goodbye to Parton
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Parton, Dolly; Parton, Dolly, 1946-;
